name: python

options.description: Use Homebrew's Tk instead of macOS Tk (has optional Cocoa and threads support)

caveats:
Python has been installed as
  /home/travis/Homebrew/bin/python3

Unversioned symlinks `python`, `python-config`, `pip` etc. pointing to
`python3`, `python3-config`, `pip3` etc., respectively, have been installed into
  /home/travis/Homebrew/opt/python/libexec/bin

If you need Homebrew's Python 2.7 run
  brew install python@2

Pip, setuptools, and wheel have been installed. To update them run
  pip3 install --upgrade pip setuptools wheel

You can install Python packages with
  pip3 install <package>
They will install into the site-package directory
  /home/travis/Homebrew/lib/python3.7/site-packages

See: https://docs.brew.sh/Homebrew-and-Python

Apple's Tcl/Tk is not recommended for use with Python on Mac OS X 10.6.
For more information see: https://www.python.org/download/mac/tcltk/
